docs.text: Welcome to Infinite Time $$\infty$$ A collection of content which may be useful to me and hopefully to others. Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Inline and block formulas render differently. For example, this is $$\sum_{i=0}^n i^2 = \frac{(n^2+\epsilon)(2n+1)}{6\phi}$$ an inline mode And the block mode looks like this (don't forget empty line!) $$\ket{\psi} = c_1\ket{E1} + c_2\ket{E2} + c_3\ket{E3}$$ $$\sum_{i=0}^n i^2 = \frac{(n^2+n)(2n+1)}{6}$$ Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Inline and block formulas render differently. For example, this is $$\sum_{i=0}^n i^2 = \frac{(n^2+\epsilon)(2n+1)}{6\phi}$$ an inline mode And the block mode looks like this (don't forget empty line!) $$\ket{\psi} = c_1\ket{E1} + c_2\ket{E2} + c_3\ket{E3}$$ $$\sum_{i=0}^n i^2 = \frac{(n^2+n)(2n+1)}{6}$$
